text: ♪ So Fly For Sci ♪

Hey, everyone, welcome back
to "So Fly For Sci."

Today we've got a guest
who turns food into fuel.

- Please welcome Cassandra.
- Hey, Israel.

Could you tell us about
turning grease into fuel?

What we do is we take
waste cooking oil,

like,
think from french fries,

and we turn that
into biodiesel fuel

which is an
environmentally friendly fuel.

We then take that fuel
and use it

to help heat the homes
of people in our community.

How did you come up
with this idea?

After learning that a lot
of families in our area

are unable to heat
their homes in the winter,

we talked to a lot
of the charities

and found out that they were
running out of funds.

Around the same time,
I went to this expo

at the university
of Rhode Island

and that's where
I actually learned

that you could turn
waste cooking oil into fuel.

So we got back together
and started thinking

if we could somehow
get people in our town

to start recycling their oil
instead of throwing it out,

then we could
turn that into fuel

to help people
in our community.

Why is recycling
important to you?

I think really it's tied
to protecting the environment.

And having grown up
in a coastal town
with a lot of beaches,

preserving that beauty
is very important to me.

I think it's also important
even though that we're young

to think of the generations
that are coming after us,

and thinking about how we can
live more sustainable lives

so that they have
a great environment
to grow up in as well.

What is the coolest thing
about helping other people?

Your really feel that
you're making a difference
in someone else's life,

and having that feeling
I think is very fulfilling.

I think that for me,
I wouldn't know
what I was doing with my life

if wasn't actually
trying to help others.

Awesome. I know you change
food into fuel,

but what's your
favorite dish to cook?
I love salmon in any form,

so I'm really into
making baked miso salmon.

I also love miso soup
on the top, like, a miso.

So I'll usually
pair those together.

- That is a delicious answer.
- ( canned laughter )

Thank you for joining us
on "So Fly For Sci."

- Both: Bye!
- ♪ So Fly For Sci ♪
